channel.title: Server cannot connect to Client?
channel.description: I posted this before. I, for some reason, can't connect to my client. No source connects to the client the source provided. If anyone would tell me the fix I'd be grateful. :)

item.title: Server cannot connect to Client?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

# Copyright (c) 1993-2009 Microsoft Corp.
#
# This is a sample HOSTS file used by Microsoft TCP/IP for Windows.
#
# This file contains the mappings of IP addresses to host names. Each
# entry should be kept on an individual line. The IP address should
# be placed in the first column followed by the corresponding host name.
# The IP address and the host name should be separated by at least one
# space.
#
# Additionally, comments (such as these) may be inserted on individual
# lines or following the machine name denoted by a '#' symbol.
#
# For example:
#
#      102.54.94.97     rhino.acme.com          # source server
#       38.25.63.10     x.acme.com              # x client host

# localhost name resolution is handled within DNS itself.
	127.0.0.1       localhost
#	::1             localhost

My hosts file.

Read full topic

vernorexia:

Easy fix if you have utorrent close the process in your task manager. same thing happened to me

utorrent can block ports, not local host…

item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

It doesn’t have to have an extension, you can still move it from the original folder, in fact, I just tested it and it worked. But what’s my word good for, eh?

Read full topic

item.title: Server cannot connect to Client?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

runescape sucks:

Try copying the file somewhere else, then moving the other file that was copied back to the original place after you change it, sometimes you can’t have administrative rights when you save, and that’s an easy solution.

The thing is. The file has no extension, if you’ve ever looked at the hosts file…

Read full topic

item.title: Server cannot connect to Client?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:21, topic:471773”][code]# localhost name resolution is handled within DNS itself.

127.0.0.1 localhost[/code]

What I have ^^[/quote]
try making it this:

# localhost name resolution is handled within DNS itself. 127.0.0.1 localhost

This is what I got:

127.0.0.1 localhost
#
#         Adobe Activation Block v2. 
#
#         For updates to the hosts check here: http://thepiratebay.org/user/thethingy
#
127.0.0.1 3dns.adobe.com 3dns-1.adobe.com 3dns-2.adobe.com 3dns-3.adobe.com 3dns-4.adobe.com activate.adobe.com activate-sea.adobe.com activate-sjc0.adobe.com activate.wip.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 activate.wip1.adobe.com activate.wip2.adobe.com activate.wip3.adobe.com activate.wip4.adobe.com adobe-dns.adobe.com adobe-dns-1.adobe.com adobe-dns-2.adobe.com adobe-dns-3.adobe.com adobe-dns-4.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 adobeereg.com practivate.adobe practivate.adobe.com practivate.adobe.newoa practivate.adobe.ntp practivate.adobe.ipp ereg.adobe.com ereg.wip.adobe.com ereg.wip1.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 ereg.wip2.adobe.com ereg.wip3.adobe.com ereg.wip4.adobe.com hl2rcv.adobe.com wip.adobe.com wip1.adobe.com wip2.adobe.com wip3.adobe.com wip4.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 www.adobeereg.com wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com www.wip.adobe.com www.wip1.adobe.com
127.0.0.1 www.wip2.adobe.com www.wip3.adobe.com www.wip4.adobe.com wwis-dubc1-vip60.adobe.com crl.verisign.net CRL.VERISIGN.NET ood.opsource.net
#
#         Any other entries you had go here (new line no # no space);

Block adobe activation ftw.

Read full topic

item.title: Server cannot connect to Client?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:19, topic:471773”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=589429.msg4176003#msg4176003 date=1355013501]

I said I can’t connect to myself in 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

Check if the client is actually set to 127.0.0.1
Some clients have 3 or 4 ip’s in them, making it almost impossible to see if it’s connecting.

My client (Galkons Refactored) has only one IP. I change the ip.

is it only the one client not working?
127.0.0.1 could be blocked too, in theory. I block mine at times when I run a wamp server.
[/quote]
How would I unblock it? Sorry, never did these stuff.[/quote]
Check to make sure it isn’t being used by programs, Theres plenty out there that run local host.
Oh, you also might want to see if 127.0.0.1 is set to local host in your hosts file:
C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts
should have this in it:
127.0.0.1 localhost
(no # in front of it)
Open hosts in notepad.

Read full topic
